definitions: small shop specializing in fashionable clothes or accessories
examples: The boutique sells handmade jewelry from local artists
She opened a boutique featuring designer vintage clothing

definitions: animal belonging to the cattle family including cows and bulls
examples: The farmer raised several bovine breeds on his ranch
Bovine diseases can affect the entire dairy industry

definitions: part of the digestive system that processes food from stomach to anus
examples: The doctor examined the patient's bowel for any abnormalities
Regular exercise helps maintain healthy bowel movements daily

definitions: pleasant shady place under trees or climbing plants in a garden
lady's private apartment or bedroom in medieval times
examples: They exchanged vows under the rose-covered bower
The garden bower provided cool shade during summer afternoons
The princess retired to her bower for the evening
Medieval ladies entertained guests in their private bower

definitions: large baleen whale living in Arctic waters with massive curved head
examples: The bowhead whale can break through thick Arctic ice
Scientists studied bowhead migration patterns near Alaska's coast

definitions: action of bending the head or upper body as greeting or respect
examples: The performer's deep bowing received thunderous applause
Traditional Japanese bowing follows specific cultural rules

definitions: player who throws the ball to the batsman in cricket
hard round hat with narrow curved brim popular in past
examples: The fast bowler took five wickets in the match
Our team's best bowler injured his shoulder yesterday
He wore a black bowler hat to the formal dinner
Charlie Chaplin made the bowler hat famous worldwide

definitions: sport where players roll balls to knock down pins in lanes
examples: The company organized a bowling night for team building
She scored three strikes during her bowling game

definitions: person skilled in using bow and arrows especially in warfare
examples: The medieval bowman could hit targets from great distances
English bowmen were feared throughout Europe for their skill

definitions: pole extending forward from a ship's bow to support sails
examples: The sailor climbed out on the bowsprit to adjust rigging
Strong winds bent the wooden bowsprit during the storm

definitions: strong cord stretched between ends of bow for shooting arrows
examples: The archer replaced the worn bowstring before competition
A snapped bowstring ended his chances at the tournament

definitions: enclosed railroad car used for transporting cargo and freight
examples: Workers loaded grain into the empty boxcar at dawn
The old boxcar served as storage on the abandoned track

definitions: person who participates in the sport of boxing with gloves
medium-sized dog breed with square muzzle and muscular build
examples: The professional boxer trained six hours every day
Both boxers showed excellent footwork during the match
Their loyal boxer dog protected the house from intruders
The boxer breed originated in Germany centuries ago

definitions: sport where two people fight with padded gloves following rules
examples: Boxing requires both physical strength and mental strategy
She took up boxing to improve her fitness level

definitions: hard pale wood from box tree used for carving and instruments
examples: The artist carved intricate figures from aged boxwood
Boxwood hedges lined the formal garden pathways beautifully

definitions: organized refusal to buy from or deal with person, organization, or country
examples: Consumers organized a boycott against the unethical company
The boycott lasted six months before achieving its goals

definitions: time of life when someone is a boy before becoming adult
examples: He spent his boyhood exploring the nearby forests
Boyhood memories of summer camps stayed with him forever

definitions: informal term for stupid or insignificant person
examples: Some bozo parked blocking the entire driveway yesterday
Don't listen to that bozo giving terrible advice

definitions: measurement of tempo in music or heart rate per minute
examples: The doctor measured her resting heart rate at 72 bpm
This dance track plays at an energetic 128 bpm

definitions: undergarment worn by women to support and cover breasts
examples: She bought a new sports bra for running
The store offered professional bra fitting services for customers

definitions: device that holds something firmly in position or supports body part
pair or set of two similar things especially game animals
examples: The dentist fitted braces to straighten her teeth
He wore a knee brace after the sports injury
The hunter returned with a brace of pheasants
She bought a brace of pistols at the auction

definitions: decorative band or chain worn around the wrist as ornament
examples: She received a gold bracelet for her birthday present
The charm bracelet held memories from many travels

definitions: system of supports or reinforcements that strengthen a structure
examples: The engineer designed additional bracing for the bridge
Metal bracing prevented the old building from collapsing

definitions: tall fern with large fronds growing on hills and in woods
examples: Dense bracken covered the hillside making walking difficult
The deer disappeared into the thick bracken undergrowth

definitions: right-angled support fixed to wall for holding shelf or object
category or group sharing similar characteristics or range
paired marks [ ] or ( ) used to enclose words or figures
examples: Install brackets before mounting the heavy shelf securely
The metal bracket broke under the excessive weight
Your income falls into a higher tax bracket this year
Teams were divided into brackets for the tournament
Put your comments in brackets after each paragraph
The editor added clarifying information within square brackets

definitions: thin nail with small head used in light carpentry
examples: Use brads to attach the delicate trim molding
The craftsman hammered brads into the picture frame

definitions: hillside or slope especially in Scotland or northern England
examples: Sheep grazed peacefully on the green Scottish brae
They built their cottage on the sunny brae overlooking town

definitions: statement expressing excessive pride in oneself or achievements
examples: His constant brags about wealth annoyed his colleagues
She made a brag about her test scores yesterday

definitions: act of talking with excessive pride about achievements or possessions
examples: His bragging about the promotion irritated coworkers
Constant bragging often masks deep personal insecurity

definitions: member of highest Hindu caste traditionally priests and scholars
breed of cattle with hump originally from India
examples: The brahman performed sacred rituals at the temple
Only brahmans could study certain ancient religious texts
Brahman cattle tolerate hot climates better than other breeds
The ranch raised brahman bulls for tropical regions

definitions: member of cultural or intellectual elite especially in New England
examples: Boston brahmins dominated the city's cultural institutions
The old brahmin families controlled local politics for generations

definitions: length of hair woven together in overlapping pattern
examples: She wore her hair in a long French braid
The child's braid came undone during recess playtime

definitions: process or art of interweaving strands of hair, rope, or fabric
examples: Braiding requires patience and steady hands to master
Traditional braiding patterns vary across different cultures worldwide

definitions: system of raised dots representing letters that blind people read by touch
examples: Public signs included braille for visually impaired visitors
She learned braille to communicate with blind students

definitions: part of skull that encloses and protects the brain
examples: The fossil's intact braincase revealed the dinosaur's brain size
Anthropologists measured the ancient human's braincase capacity

definitions: idea or invention regarded as particular person's creation
examples: The new app was her brainchild after months of planning
This innovative program is the brainchild of our CEO

definitions: informal term for exceptionally smart or intellectual person
examples: The young brainiac solved complex equations before high school
Every team wanted the brainiac for their quiz competition

definitions: central trunk of brain connecting spinal cord controlling basic life functions
examples: The brainstem regulates breathing and heart rate automatically
Damage to the brainstem can affect vital body functions

definitions: spontaneous group discussion to produce ideas and solve problems creatively
examples: The team held a brainstorm to generate marketing ideas
Our best solutions came from an informal brainstorm yesterday

definitions: group activity of suggesting ideas spontaneously without criticism
examples: Brainstorming sessions produced innovative solutions to old problems
Effective brainstorming requires open minds and no judgment

definitions: systematic effort to change someone's beliefs using psychological pressure and propaganda
examples: The cult used brainwashing techniques on vulnerable members
Prisoners underwent brainwashing to change their political views

definitions: device for slowing or stopping vehicle or machine using friction
examples: Press the brake pedal gently when approaching red lights
The mechanic replaced worn brake pads on her car

definitions: railroad employee responsible for operating train brakes and coupling cars
examples: The brakeman signaled when all cars were properly connected
Early brakemen risked their lives jumping between moving cars

definitions: prickly shrub especially blackberry with long thorny stems
examples: Children picked berries from brambles along the country path
Thick brambles blocked access to the abandoned garden
